title: Ticket #6150: Improve output before annex attempt.
description:
Particularly once we have a default for lease duration, and when the no-claim timeout can be set from the command-line (but has a default), it makes sense to print out, before we actually do anything, what we're going to do. For example: 

$ condor_annex -count 75
Is it OK to request 75 m4.large instances, with a no-claim timeout of 0.25 hours and a lease duration of .83 hours?
(Please type 'yes' or 'no'):

Where if the user types no (or anything that's not 'yes', really), we reply 

To change the instance type, use the -instance-type flag.
To change the lease duration, use the -lease-duration flag.
To change the no-claim timeout, use the -noclaim-timeout flag.
